duties_responsibilities.duty: Provide technical expertise in the design of electrical systems and products.
Evaluate systems' safety, reliability, and performance.
Recommend equipment, new concepts and techniques to improve performance, simplify processes, and improve material designs or material flaw as related to electrical systems and components.

Work collaboratively with the engineering team and various plant personnel to improve electrical/digital component and product designs on existing products or develop new products related to Zero Turn Lawnmowers (ZTR) and grain drying equipment.
Size and specify electrical parts and electronic components.

Lead the design improvements on existing products as related to electrical systems and components, and new product designs for ZTR lawnmowers, grain/crop dryers, heaters/burners, fans, controls, material handling equipment, and grain storage.
Use knowledge of electrical design, PLC programming, and engineering techniques to provide technical leadership to the other members for the department.
Interpret mechanical design drawings for electrical requirements.
Ensure that installation and operations conform to standards by preparing electrical systems specifications and technical drawings.
Use 2D and/or 3D drafting skills in product design and development, electrical schematics/diagrams, and specifications.
Interface with customers/dealers to obtain practical understanding of requirements to design new products and improve existing products to meet the demands of the market.
Communicate and coordinate with manufacturing staff and procurement specialists to ensure manufacturability and cost control of the finished product.
Participate in product development testing to validate the design concepts in the R&D Shop/Area, and often with in-field testing.

Create detailed manufacturing prints, bill of materials, and operating instructions for all products and improvements while interfacing with Sales, Manufacturing, and Procurement to ensure an integrated, efficient product roll-out.
Assist with troubleshooting and problem-solving by working directly with the design team, production supervisors/managers, quality personnel, and shop floor production teams as needed.
Maintain consistent communication with the supervisor on the status of assigned tasks.
Actively participate in continuous improvement activities.
Follow safety rules and regulations in performing work assignments and maintain a clean and orderly work area.
Travel to project sites to evaluate, research, and fix product issues, when needed.
May assist in other areas of engineering as desired.
